sentences.english: Do not trim those wisteria vines.
The entire plant, also known as a kidney bean tree, is toxic, though some say the flowers are not.
sentences.chinese: 紫藤全株有毒，但也有人说花穗无毒。

sentences.english: The begonias and wisteria he planted in his courtyard are the oldest known in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他院中亲手种植的海棠和紫藤树是北京最老的。

sentences.english: After seven series, the "for sale" signs are finally going up on Wisteria Lane.
sentences.chinese: 在播出七季后，紫藤巷最终挂上了“出售”标牌。

sentences.english: Spring comes every year to Wisteria Lane.
sentences.chinese: 每年，春天都会降临在紫藤街。

sentences.english: Yes, everyone knows how to bargain on wisteria lane.
sentences.chinese: 紫藤街上每个人都深谙交易之道。

sentences.english: And so my husband returned to Wisteria Lane.
sentences.chinese: 于是我的丈夫回到了紫藤郡。

sentences.english: Wisteria to me the spirit of quiet joy and health.
sentences.chinese: 紫藤花给我精神的宁静和生的喜悦。

sentences.english: Yellow and white drops of sun splashed through the wisteria canopy above us.
sentences.chinese: 黄白相间的阳光从我们头顶密密的紫藤的间隙筛下来。

definition: narcissus/daffodil/legendary aquatic immortal/refers to those buried at sea/person who wanders abroad and does not return
Boston ivy or Japanese creeper (Parthenocissus tricuspidata)
